symptoms.name: Skin sores
symptoms.severity: Variable, can range from single, limited lesion to multiple, large, locally destructive lesions
symptoms.pattern: Initially painless, brownish, erythematous papule that gradually enlarges into a nodule or plaque, then ulcerates from the center, forming a brownish crust.  May develop into a 'volcanic ulcer' with sloping, firm margins and a prominent central crater.

symptoms.name: Ulcer
symptoms.pattern: Develops from nodule, central ulceration with brownish crust

physical_findings: Volcanic ulcer (sloping, firm margins with prominent central crater)
Lesions often on exposed body parts (face, forearms, lower legs)
risk_factors: Living in or traveling to endemic areas

required: Clinical presentation consistent with cutaneous leishmaniasis (papule, nodule, ulcer)
History of living in or traveling to an endemic area 1-6 months prior to lesion appearance
supportive: Positive microscopic examination or culture of Leishmania parasites

differential_diagnoses: Malignant tumors (basal or squamous cell carcinomas)
